reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked to stay at Padstow Touring Park over the Jubilee weekend. The campsite is very clean and provides excellent facilities including hot showers, hair dryers in the amenities block, a freezer for ice packs and a great shop and tourist information. All the staff we came into contact with were helpful and polite. The campsite is really very good value and in a great location, we definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Superb value and extremely impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have stayed here twice during the summer holidays, lovely site, clean, good size pitches, we love Padstow and one of the selling points for us is that you can walk into Padstow in the middle of the summer season, no worrys about car parking. It's a nice walk, takes about 20-30minutes depending on how the kids are feeling, worth taking a torch for the journey home, we have been lucky and been able to do the walk in flip flips/ crocs, if its wet may need trainers etc. Wifi availble for a small fee. If your looking for bingo and a disco not for you but we will definately book again.
reviews.title: lovely campsite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here over the Easter holiday and it was wonderful. Great location, which was close to the town centre yet very peaceful. Fantastic facilities and very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Brilliant location, wonderful site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The site is spotlessly clean and has a wonderful atmosphere.
reviews.title: Excellent Site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definately be back again.
reviews.title: If you're late - it's the naughty corner for you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice and clean, good size pitch and friendly staff. Just a short walk down into Padstow and a £6 taxi back after indulging in the local tipple. Excellent onsite shop - loos and showers clean and tidy (shower curtains just a little close and low down for the bigger/ taller visitor, but no real problem). Will happily visit again.
reviews.title: happy days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent touring park. Beautifully kept, clean and tidy. Bathroom facilites were some of the best we've encountered. Pitch was a very spacious deluxe pitch with water easily accesible from the electric hook up point. No problems whatsoever and would highly recommend. If you are after 'entertainment facilities' then this is proabaly not the site for you. Padstow is easilly reached by footpath, but the walk back up the hill not for the faint hearted! There are buses or taxis available though. However gives you chance to walk the fish & chips off!
reviews.title: Smashing, super, great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Padstow Touring Park with a 7 meter long Motor home. We had a hard standing fully serviced pitch . The site is well serviced with shower blocks and there is also a motor home service bay. Showers and Toilets where very clean, and serviced from 7:30 in the morning. Our reception was cheerful and very friendly without being too "in your face". The hook up for water was too far from our pitch to run the hose for a constant top up but that was not really a problem as we just filled up on our return after trips out. I am sure we could have moved if we wanted to. On the second morning we discovered that we where on top of a wasp nest. As soon as this was reported, it was sorted out by a very helpful young man who put poison down. He popped back next day to check all was well. Very good service.
reviews.title: Better Than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The park is a 30 minute walk into Padstow Harbour or a £1.50 each way bus ride. (we waited for the bus longer than the walk took) or a £5 taxi ride. One thing, there is not taxi rank in Padtow, so take the numbers with you!
reviews.title: Another great holiday at Padstow Touring Park!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Park is very well supervised and has strict no nonsense rules with regard to bad behavior etc.
reviews.title: A really good, clean pleasant camp site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: just come home from 16 nights at this lovely site. caravan tw0 adults 2 children. very spacious pitches very clean and well maintained. toilets immaculate even when raining not a spec of mud. padstow about 25 mins walk away thro fields and over stiles but my children aged 7 and 10 managed it easily . unfortunately i didnt bring sturdier footwaer but you do need proper footwear . the tesco is about 1 minute away in the car and you can come back from padstow on the park and ride bus and you get off in a field near the site. other comments have said it is windy but the owners of the site cant help that its just the weather in the uk. graet beaches 1-2 miles away with lifeguards tervone and harlyn. we booked for next year !
reviews.title: fantastic going back next year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just camped at this park and booked a deluxe pitch which gave us more than ample room for our spacious 4 berth tent and plenty of outdoor space. Nice touch to have the water supply on your pitch too.
reviews.title: Lovely site, looking forward to future visits!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The park's information sheet provided lots of useful information about the local area including local attractions and towns to visit, beaches, suggested walks, local bus service info and places to eat. If you like the beach, the location is perfect as there are numerous in the area, some of which are within a short 10-20 minute driving distance.
reviews.title: Excellent shower and toilet facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Washroom facilities always clean when we used them and surprisingly even though our stay was during school holidays, I didn't have to queue to use the showers. I guess this is helped by there being three facility blocks. Dishwashing facilities were also very clean and the freezer for ice packs came in very handy.
reviews.title: Well run park, friendly and organised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: There is no on-site bar which didn't bother us at the time of booking. As mentioned by previous reviewers, the walk through the fields to Padstow is very pleasant. However given how clumsy I can be, I didn't fancy walking back from Padstow after a few drinks like some reviewers have done.
reviews.title: Don't go anywhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my partner and I camped for just over a week, the stroll through farms and local streets to padstow is lovely (if a little hilly on the way back after a few ciders...), pitches were large, facilities great and close by, toilets and showers kept spotless. will definitely come back.
reviews.title: great base for a holiday in padstow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of good things to say about this site - large pitches, excellent location just outside Padstow, good clean facilities (yes, 15 seconds of shower before having to press again is rather annoying).
reviews.title: Lovely site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: It can be very windy being high on a hill and the tent took a battering. The shop is basic and rather expensive but there is a Tesco half a mile away....walk over the fields or drive.
reviews.title: Back for more!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Ice packs frozen free, plugs for hair driers in the dishwashing block. Quite peaceful with occasional noise from the road during the day and the farm next door with a very vociferous cockerel!
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay. Polite staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A good base with beaches, restaurants and pubs all within a mile.
reviews.title: Brilliant all-round!
